normalization.p: All obvious spelling and typographical errors in the original source material is corrected. The choice element has been used to enclose sic and corr elements giving the original error and correction, respectively.
Whenever necessary, spacing between words and following punctuation has been regularized to zero spaces; spacing between words has been regularized to one space.

Instances of African American Vernacular English have purposefully NOT been adjusted to comply with American English language practices. African American Vernacular English is wholly valid in its form, features, and creativity, despite the dominance and presumed correctness of American English.

hey guyss :) My name is Jevel Quinlan and I'm a sophomore. I decided to stop perming my hair in March 2016 but I stil flat ironed my hair every two weeks. I stoped flat ironing my air August 2017. This past June I cut off all my iffy hair and I'm COMPLETELY NATURAL. I do many different protective styles(braids, cornrows , closure ) that I usually keep for 2 months. My go to natural styles are twist and braid outs . My fave product rn is Shea Moisture's Curling Gel Souffle!! For newly natural babies/anyone who's considering going natural, understand that becoming natural is a PROCESS, it doean't happen overnight. ALso Please don't stay with one brand, try all different kinds of products, you'll understand your hair better, gind nice products and figute out what doesn't work for your hair. Last but not least: BUY YOUR HAIR PRODUCTS FROM MARSHALLS, TJ MAXX OR ROSS, wayyyyyway cheaper than beauty stores. And in general buy you hair products from common stores like walmart, target, cvs, online... etc becauty stores prices are highway robbery. Das it That's it.
